New Records: New York Yankees advanced to their 41st World Series, their first in 15 years
Juan Soto hit a three-run homer in the 10th inning
Giancarlo Stanton was named ALCS MVP
Key Match Events: Yankees won the series in a 5-2 victory over the Guardians in Game 5
Game was tied 2-2 in the 10th inning before Soto's homer
Stanton hit a two-run homer in the series
Soto's at-bat was described as 'one for the ages'
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were expected to be a strong contender
Juan Soto's acquisition was a key move for the Yankees
The team's resilience was highlighted after a tough season
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's performance
Stephen Vogt acknowledged the Guardians' effort but their playoff run ended short
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees' drought dates back to 1948
Game was played at Progressive Field
Others: The Yankees' core stayed mostly intact
Soto's leadership and integration into the team were noted
